name: electricity production, wind, 1-3MW turbine, onshore | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7366/documentation

This dataset represents the production of  high voltage electricity at onshore grid-connected wind power plants with a capacity between 1-3  MW in Peru. The reference dataset used was electricity production, wind, 1-3MW turbine, onshore, label-certified, GLO, accessed in November, 2017. Parameters such as annual electricity production volume, installed capacity and wind load hours were adapted. Data from three wind farms was used, these farms are: Cupinisque, Talara and Marcona (COES, 2014).  Data was obtained from the Committee of Economic Operations of the National Interconnected System (COES, 2014), the national peruvian entity that regulates the dispatch and generation of energy from the electricity sector. The COES publishes the statistics of operations of the National Interconnected System (SEIN) in an annual basis. The operational statistics for year 2014 were used.  In addition, data from OSINERGMIN (2015) was used for installed capacity information.                                                             Renewable energies have entered into operation between 2011 and 2012 in Peru. ;Wind electricity generation in 2014 was of 0.56%. of thetotal  production of electricity in the country, a total of 256.31 GWh. Data from three wind power plants plants, which represent 100% of total wind generation, was used(COES, 2014).;Sources: COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, 2014. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/08_PRODUCCION CON RECURSOS RENOVABLES DEL SEIN,CUADRO N° 8.2 POR TIPO DE GENERACIÓN CON RER, 2014 and CUADRO N° 8.4 D PRODUCCIÓN DE ENERGÍA ELÉCTRICA DE CENTRALES CON RECURSOS ENERGÉTICOS RENOVABLES DE ORIGEN EÓLICO 2014 - GW.h. 22 august 2017.;MINEM, 2014. Balance Nacional de Energía. Retrieved online from: http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/PUBLI_BNE_2014(1).pdf, 10 January 2017.;OSINERGMIN, 2015. CENTRALES DE GENERACIÓN ELÉCTRICA ‐ EN OPERACIÓN, (Inversiones en Concesiones / Autorizaciones Otorgadas por el Ministerio de Energía y Minas desde el Año 1996). Retrieved online https://www.osinergmin.gob.pe/seccion/centro_documental/electricidad/Documentos/PROYECTOS%20GFE/Generaci%C3%B3n/2-EN-OPERACION.pdf, 25 January 2017.

From operation of the wind power plant to high voltage electricity at the plant. According to (European Communities 2001), electricity produced with wind turbines in a wind power plant is connected to medium voltage or high voltage systems, depending on the size of the windfarm. Normally, each wind turbine contains a transformer from low voltage to medium voltage. The network connection additionally transforms the electricity to high voltage electricity. It is assumed here, that there are no stand-alone grid-connected small wind turbines and that all electricity is connected to the network in form of high voltage electricity. 

Source:
European Communities. 2001. Wind Turbine Grid Connection and Interaction. Deutsches Windenergie-Institut /Tech-wise A/S /DM Energy, p. 7 Tab.2.1


This activity ends with the production of 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and delivered to the grid.

This dataset includes 
 - the operation and maintenance of the wind power plant
 - change of lubricating oil every year

This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in infrastructure datasets
 - transformation of the electricity produced in order to deliver in to the grid as this is already included in the infrastructure datasets.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: In Peru, the Economic Operation Committee of the National Interconnected System (COES) is divided in three operation areas, north, central and south. The three wind generation power plants considered in this dataset are located as follows: in the north operation area Cupisnique and Talara; in the south area Marcona.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology of a 2MW Vestas V80 wind power plant modelled with a dataset for the wind turbine (moving+fixed parts) and a network connection each.;See dataset "wind turbine construction, 2MW, onshore" for detailed technical information.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The reference dataset used was electricity production, wind, 1-3MW turbine, onshore, label-certified, GLO, 2010-2015, accessed in November, 2017. Parameters such as annual electricity production volume, installed capacity and wind load hours were adapted to regionalize the dataset to Peruvian conditions in year 2014.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Statistics reports and literature calculations for three plants in Peru that represent 100% of wind power production. These are: Cupisnique, Marcona, Talara (COES, 2014).
